abstract: University of California researchers, reporting in journal Science, propose groundbreaking improvement to fiber optic technology that could theoretically double its information capacity; technology would allow lasers to travel far greater distances without the need for amplification, significantly reducing cost while increasing bandwidth; some scientists have expressed skepticism.
lead_paragraph: A group of electrical engineers says that sending information in a new fashion could, in theory, double the capacity of fiber-optic circuits.

headline.main: An Advance May Double the Capabilities of Fiber Optics
headline.print_headline: An Advance May Double Fiber Optics’ Capabilities

snippet: A group of electrical engineers says that sending information in a new fashion could, in theory, double the capacity of fiber-optic circuits.

keywords.value: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)
